text: Giorgio Morandi (July 20, 1890 â€“ June 18, 1964) was an Italian painter and printmaker who specialized in still life. His paintings are noted for their tonal subtlety in depicting apparently simple subjects, which were limited mainly to vases, bottles, bowls, flowers and landscapes. ==Related pages== * List of Italian painters Category:1890 births Category:1964 deaths Category:Italian painters Category:Italian artists Category:People from Bologna Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Italy
